<li id="cite_note-Borman1986-275"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Borman1986_275-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs2 cs1-prop-jul-greg-uncertainty" id="CITEREFGandhi1920">Gandhi, Mohandis K. (11 August 1920), <a class="external text" href="https://www.gandhiheritageportal.org/datalink/files/ghp_journals/journal_image_3/young_india_vol2_img251.jpg" rel="nofollow">"The Doctrine of the Sword"</a>, <i>Young India</i>, M. K. Gandhi: 3<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 May</span> 2017</span></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Young+India&amp;rft.atitle=The+Doctrine+of+the+Sword&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.date=1920-08-11&amp;rft.aulast=Gandhi&amp;rft.aufirst=Mohandis+K.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gandhiheritageportal.org%2Fdatalink%2Ffiles%2Fghp_journals%2Fjournal_image_3%2Fyoung_india_vol2_img251.jpg&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span> Cited from <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBorman,_William1986">Borman, William (1986). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=U6DE9OUvrTEC&amp;pg=PA253" rel="nofollow"><i>Gandhi and nonviolence</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-325"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-325">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#Wolpert">Wolpert</a>, p. 22.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-herman89-326"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-herman89_326-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-herman89_326-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFArthur_Herman2008">Arthur Herman (2008). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=tquxD6dk914C" rel="nofollow"><i>Gandhi &amp; Churchill: The Epic Rivalry that Destroyed an Empire and Forged Our Age</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Random_House" title="Random House">Random House</a>. pp. 89–90, 294–95. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-553-90504-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-553-90504-5"><bdi>978-0-553-90504-5</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140913065817/http://books.google.com/books?id=tquxD6dk914C" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 13 September 2014.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Gandhi+%26+Churchill%3A+The+Epic+Rivalry+that+Destroyed+an+Empire+and+Forged+Our+Age&amp;rft.pages=89-90%2C+294-95&amp;rft.pub=Random+House&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-553-90504-5&amp;rft.au=Arthur+Herman&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DtquxD6dk914C&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-339"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-339">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFWinthrop_Sargeant2010">Winthrop Sargeant (2010). </li>
<li id="cite_note-GreatSoulReview-353"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-GreatSoulReview_353-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-GreatSoulReview_353-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFRoberts,_Andrew2011"><a href="/wiki/Andrew_Roberts_(historian)" title="Andrew Roberts (historian)">Roberts, Andrew</a> (26 March 2011). <a class="external text" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748703529004576160371482469358" rel="nofollow">"Among the Hagiographers (A book review of "Great Soul: Mahatma Gandhi and His Struggle With India" by Joseph Lelyveld)"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Wall_Street_Journal" title="The Wall Street Journal">The Wall Street Journal</a></i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120103114003/http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703529004576160371482469358.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 3 January 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">14 January</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Wall+Street+Journal&amp;rft.atitle=Among+the+Hagiographers+%28A+book+review+of+%22Great+Soul%3A+Mahatma+Gandhi+and+His+Struggle+With+India%22+by+Joseph+Lelyveld%29&amp;rft.date=2011-03-26&amp;rft.au=Roberts%2C+Andrew&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2FSB10001424052748703529004576160371482469358&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-356"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-356">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1">"Mahatma martyred will be stronger than Mahatma living. <li id="cite_note-357"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-357">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBenjamin,_N.Narkulwad,_Ganesh2019">Benjamin, N.; Narkulwad, Ganesh (2019). <a class="external text" href="https://gandhimargjournal.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/1.-OCTOBER-2018-MARCH-2019.pdf#page=38" rel="nofollow">"Gandhi's Links with Poona: An Overview"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Gandhi Marg</i>. <b>40</b> (3–4): 165–186.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Gandhi+Marg&amp;rft.atitle=Gandhi%27s+Links+with+Poona%3A+An+Overview&amp;rft.volume=40&amp;rft.issue=3%E2%80%934&amp;rft.pages=165-186&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft.au=Benjamin%2C+N.&amp;rft.au=Narkulwad%2C+Ganesh&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fgandhimargjournal.org%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2020%2F10%2F1.-OCTOBER-2018-MARCH-2019.pdf%23page%3D38&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-358"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-358">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSankar_Ghose1991">Sankar Ghose (1991). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=5l0BPnxN1h8C&amp;pg=PA236" rel="nofollow"><i>Mahatma Gandhi</i></a>. Allied Publishers. p. 236. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-81-7023-205-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-81-7023-205-6"><bdi>978-81-7023-205-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Mahatma+Gandhi&amp;rft.pages=236&amp;rft.pub=Allied+Publishers&amp;rft.date=1991&amp;rft.isbn=978-81-7023-205-6&amp;rft.au=Sankar+Ghose&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D5l0BPnxN1h8C%26pg%3DPA236&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-359"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-359">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRajmohan_Gandhi2006">Rajmohan Gandhi (2006). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=FauJL7LKXmkC&amp;pg=PA385" rel="nofollow"><i>Gandhi: The Man, His People, and the Empire</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/University_of_California_Press" title="University of California Press">University of California Press</a>. p. 385. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-520-25570-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-520-25570-8"><bdi>978-0-520-25570-8</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Gandhi%3A+The+Man%2C+His+People%2C+and+the+Empire&amp;rft.pages=385&amp;rft.pub=University+of+California+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-520-25570-8&amp;rft.au=Rajmohan+Gandhi&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DFauJL7LKXmkC%26pg%3DPA385&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-360"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-360">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFKR_Rao1975">KR Rao (1975).  MVVS Murthi;  et al. (eds.). "Satyagraha: Gandhi's yoga of nonviolence". <i>Journal of Gandhian Studies</i>. Gandhi Bhawan, University of Allahabad. <b>3</b>: 48.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Gandhian+Studies&amp;rft.atitle=Satyagraha%3A+Gandhi%27s+yoga+of+nonviolence&amp;rft.volume=3&amp;rft.pages=48&amp;rft.date=1975&amp;rft.au=KR+Rao&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span>;<br/>Laxman Kawale (2012), <i>Dalit's Social Transformation: Redefining the Social Justice</i>, ISRJ, Volume 1, Issue XII, page 3; Quote: "Even though Ambedkar was a party to Poona Pact, he was never reconciled to it. His contempt against [sic] Gandhi ... continued even after his assassination on January 30, 1948. On the death of Gandhi, he expressed, "My real enemy has gone; thank goodness the eclipse is over". He equated the assassination of Gandhi with that of Caesar and the remark of Cicero to the messenger – "Tell the Romans, your hour of liberty has come". He further remarked, "While one regrets the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi, one cannot help finding in his heart the echo of the sentiments expressed by Cicero on the assassination of Caesar".</span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-369"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-369">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGillen,_PaulGhosh,_Devleena2007">Gillen, Paul &amp; Ghosh, Devleena (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=bnQk28Du5poC&amp;pg=PA130" rel="nofollow"><i>Colonialism and Modernity</i></a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-383"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-383">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFChakrabarty,_Bidyut1992">Chakrabarty, Bidyut (1992). Macmillan. p. 2. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-312-20079-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-312-20079-4"><bdi>978-0-312-20079-4</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Rabindranath+Tagore%3A+an+anthology&amp;rft.pages=2&amp;rft.pub=Macmillan&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-312-20079-4&amp;rft.aulast=Tagore&amp;rft.aufirst=Rabindranath&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-400"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-400">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGuha2013">Guha, Ramachandra (2013). <a class="external text" href="http://archive.org/details/gandhibeforeindia" rel="nofollow"><i>Gandhi Before India</i></a>. pp. 362, 662. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-670-08387-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-670-08387-9"><bdi>978-0-670-08387-9</bdi></a>. <q>During my last trip to Europe I saw a great deal of Mr Gandhi. From year to year (I have known him intimately for over twenty years) I have found him getting more and more selfless. He is now leading almost an ascetic sort of life – not the life of an ordinary ascetic that we usually see but that of a great Mahatma and the one idea that engrosses his mind is his motherland.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Gandhi+Before+India&amp;rft.pages=362%2C+662&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-670-08387-9&amp;rft.aulast=Guha&amp;rft.aufirst=Ramachandra&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fgandhibeforeindia&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-401"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-401">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Pranjivan Mehta to G. K. Gokhale, dated Rangoon, 8 November 1909, File No. 4, Servants of India Society Papers, NMML.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-403"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-403">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#Desai">Desai</a>, p. viii.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-404"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-404">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Basu Majumdar, A. K. (1993), <i>Rabindranath Tagore: The Poet of India</i>, Indus Publishing, <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/81-85182-92-2" title="Special:BookSources/81-85182-92-2">81-85182-92-2</a>, p. 83: "When Gandhi returned to India, Rabindranath's eldest brother Dwijendranath, was perhaps the first to address him as Mahatma. Rabindranath followed suit and then the whole of India called him Mahatma Gandhi."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-405"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-405">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGhose,_Sankar1991">Ghose, Sankar (1991). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=5l0BPnxN1h8C&amp;pg=PA158" rel="nofollow"><i>Mahatma Gandhi</i></a>. Allied Publishers. p. 158. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-81-7023-205-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-81-7023-205-6"><bdi>978-81-7023-205-6</bdi></a>. <q>So Tagore differed from many of Gandhi's ideas, but yet he had great regard for him and Tagore was perhaps the first important Indian who called Gandhi a Mahatma. But in 1921 when Gandhi was asked whether he was really a Mahatma Gandhi replied that he did not feel like one, and that, in any event, he could not define a Mahatma for he had never met any.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Mahatma+Gandhi&amp;rft.pages=158&amp;rft.pub=Allied+Publishers&amp;rft.date=1991&amp;rft.isbn=978-81-7023-205-6&amp;rft.au=Ghose%2C+Sankar&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D5l0BPnxN1h8C%26pg%3DPA158&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-406"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-406">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGuha2007">Guha, Ramachandra (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/indiaaftergandhi00guha" rel="nofollow"><i>India After Gandhi: The History of the World's Largest Democracy</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-Albano-Müller-417"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Albano-Müller_417-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120117104005/http://www.gandhiserve.org/streams/einstein.html" rel="nofollow">"Einstein on Gandhi (Einstein's letter to Gandhi – Courtesy:Saraswati Albano-Müller &amp; Notes by Einstein on Gandhi – Source: The Hebrew University of Jerusalem )"</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-:1-418"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-:1_418-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFUwechue1981">Uwechue, Raph (1981). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=zTlyAAAAMAAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>Makers of Modern Africa: Profiles in History</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-432"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-432">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.currentscience.ac.in/Downloads/article_id_006_06_0311_0316_0.pdf" rel="nofollow">"University and Educational Intelligence"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i><a href="/wiki/Current_Science" title="Current Science">Current Science</a></i>. <b>6</b> (6): 314. December 1937.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Current+Science&amp;rft.atitle=University+and+Educational+Intelligence&amp;rft.volume=6&amp;rft.issue=6&amp;rft.pages=314&amp;rft.date=1937-12&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.currentscience.ac.in%2FDownloads%2Farticle_id_006_06_0311_0316_0.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></span>
</li>

</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Scholarly_articles">Scholarly articles</span></h3>
<ul><li>Danielson, Leilah C. "'In My Extremity I Turned to Gandhi': American Pacifists, Christianity, and Gandhian Nonviolence, 1915–1941". <i>Church History</i> 72.2 (2003): 361–388.</li>
<li>Du Toit, Brian M. "The Mahatma Gandhi and South Africa." <i>Journal of Modern African Studies</i> 34#4 (1996): 643–660. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/161593" rel="nofollow">161593</a>.</li>
<li>Gokhale, B. G. "Gandhi and the British Empire," <i>History Today</i> (Nov 1969), 19#11 pp 744–751 online.</li>
<li>Juergensmeyer, Mark. "The Gandhi Revival – A Review Article." <i>The Journal of Asian Studies</i> 43#2 (Feb. 1984), pp. 293–298. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/2055315" rel="nofollow">2055315</a></li>
<li>Kishwar, Madhu. "Gandhi on Women." <i>Economic and Political Weekly</i> 20, no. 41 (1985): 1753–758. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/4374920" rel="nofollow">4374920</a>.</li>
<li>Murthy, C. S. H. N., Oinam Bedajit Meitei, and Dapkupar Tariang. "The Tale Of Gandhi Through The Lens: An Inter-Textual Analytical Study Of Three Major Films-Gandhi, The Making Of The Mahatma, And Gandhi, My Father." <i>CINEJ Cinema Journal</i> 2.2 (2013): 4–37. <a class="external text" href="https://cinej.pitt.edu/ojs/index.php/cinej/article/download/66/239" rel="nofollow">online</a></li>
<li>Power, Paul F. "Toward a Revaluation of Gandhi's Political Thought." <i>Western Political Quarterly</i> 16.1 (1963): 99–108 <a class="external text" href="https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/106591296301600107?journalCode=prqa" rel="nofollow">excerpt</a>.</li>
<li>Rudolph, Lloyd I. "Gandhi in the Mind of America." <i>Economic and Political Weekly</i> 45, no. 47 (2010): 23–26. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/25764146" rel="nofollow">25764146</a>.</li></ul>

<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFParel,_Anthony_J.2009">Parel, Anthony J., ed. (2009). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=oc47gUOPZfcC" rel="nofollow"><i>Gandhi: "Hind Swaraj" and Other Writings Centenary Edition</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-14602-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-14602-9"><bdi>978-0-521-14602-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Gandhi%3A+%22Hind+Swaraj%22+and+Other+Writings+Centenary+Edition&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2009&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-14602-9&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Doc47gUOPZfcC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMahatma+Gandhi"></span></li></ul>
</div>

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Aristotle" title="Aristotle">Aristotle</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Augustine_of_Hippo" title="Augustine of Hippo">Augustine</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Chanakya" title="Chanakya">Chanakya</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Cicero" title="Cicero">Cicero</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Confucius" title="Confucius">Confucius</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Han_Fei" title="Han Fei">Han Fei</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Lactantius" title="Lactantius">Lactantius</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Mencius" title="Mencius">Mencius</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Mozi" title="Mozi">Mozi</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Origen" title="Origen">Origen</a></li>
